contrib: Worldbuilding, Scenario Writing, Dialogue, and Characters by JaidynReiman{br}{br}Map Designs, Event Coding, Game Mechanics by JaidynReiman

Lex Talionis Engine and LT-Maker Editor created by rainlash{br}{br}Lex Talionis is a non-profit engine, released for free, and developed using Python, Pygame, and PyQt5. Some default assets are copyrighted or trademarked by their respective owners.{br}{br}Licensed under the MIT License.
With additional programming and help from the Lex Talionis Discord server, including mag, KD, Sigmaraven, TheeBill, Lord Tweed, ZessDynamite, Nemid, Kyogokudo, beccarte, Meinerieve, Greentwip, Klokinator, Sealvester, Joytis, and aorlnn.{br}{br}Narrow fonts and droppable item icon originally created by Scraiza.

All assets used were either modifications by me or imported from the FE Graphics and Music Repositories:
https://github.com/Klokinator/FE-Repo{br}{br}Special Thanks to Klokinator, Jj09 and Jey the Count for gathering all these resources.
Most icon sheets were compiled or cleaned up by JaidynReiman from existing icons in the Repo. Even the existing full sheets in the repo were not designed for LT and had to be cleaned up.

contrib:
All portraits are either from the FE Art Community in the FE Repo or are vanilla IS. All of them are only placeholders; I intend on making new portraits to replace them.
The portraits made by me were generated using AI portrait generators to be as close to my characters as possible. I then recreated the designs in sprite form and cleaned them up.
The Bust Style Portraits (Shayala) initially started as an AI generation, but after making the sprite I liked the style enough to try using this for all portraits. While the initial portrait was AI, almost all revisions and new characters were mostly custom and extended off this original design.
Huge shout out to BBHood for ripping GBA spell animations and converting them to LT. Also for including many custom animations from the FE-Repo.

AuraWolf for the Snap a Crap Pack V3.1 maps. These have been useful to learn how to properly design maps aesthetically using FEGBA style tilesets.{br}{br}I took a lot of inspiration for certain tile placements. The ship tiles especially are quite complicated.
